pages.question_text: Do you have a National Insurance number?
pages.hint_text: Read page 3 of the CH2 Notes.

pages.question_text: Your title
pages.hint_text: For example Mrs, Miss, Ms, Mr or Dr

pages.question_text: Your last name or family name
Your first name and any middle names
Have you ever been known by any other last names or family names including your maiden name?
Your date of birth
Your address
Have you lived at this address for more than 12 months?
Tell us your last address
Your mobile number or landline if you do not have a mobile
pages.hint_text: We may contact you about your claim. Our number may not show up if we call you.

pages.question_text: What is your nationality?
pages.hint_text: This is shown on your passport if you have one. For example, British, Irish, French, Polish.

pages.question_text: Have you claimed Child Benefit for any children before?
Are you currently entitled to or receiving Child Benefit?
Child's last name
Child's first name
Child's middle names
Child's date of birth
Have you always lived in the UK?
pages.hint_text: By this we mean you've never lived outside the UK. Read page 3 of the CH2 Notes.

pages.question_text: Do you usually live in the UK?
pages.hint_text: Read page 3 of the CH2 Notes.

pages.question_text: Which country do you usually live in?
Tell us the date you arrived in the UK
Are you subject to immigration control now, or have you been at any time in the last 6 months?
pages.hint_text: Read page 3 of the CH2 Notes.

pages.question_text: If you've been subject to immigration control in the last 3 months, tell us the date your immigration status was granted
What is your employment status?
pages.hint_text: Tick the box or boxes that apply. You only need to answer this question if you've ever lived outside of the UK.

options.value: Looking for work in the UK
options.text: Looking for work in the UK

options.value: None of these - I've enough money to support my family in the UK
options.text: None of these - I've enough money to support my family in the UK

pages.question_text: Do you work in another country or receive benefit from another country, or have you at any time in the last 3 months?
Are you a member of HM Forces or a civil servant working abroad?
What is your marital or civil partnership status?
pages.hint_text: Tick one box that applies. We consider you single for Child Benefit purposes unless you live with a partner.

options.value: Married or in a civil partnership
options.text: Married or in a civil partnership

options.value: Living with a partner as if you're married or a civil partner since
options.text: Living with a partner as if you're married or a civil partner since

pages.question_text: Your partner's full name
Your partner's date of birth
Your partner's National Insurance number
pages.hint_text: Read page 3 of the CH2 Notes.

pages.question_text: Your partner's nationality
pages.hint_text: This is shown on their passport if they have one, for example British, Irish, French, Polish.

pages.question_text: What is your partner's employment status?
pages.hint_text: Tick the box or boxes that apply.

options.value: Looking for work in the UK
options.text: Looking for work in the UK

options.value: None of these - they have enough money to support their family in the UK
options.text: None of these - they have enough money to support their family in the UK

pages.question_text: Is your partner a member of HM Forces or a civil servant working abroad?
Does your partner now, or have they at any time in the last 3 months, worked in another country or received benefit from another country?
Is your partner entitled to Child Benefit now or are they waiting to hear if they can get Child Benefit?
What is the full name of the eldest child your partner is entitled to Child Benefit for?
Child's date of birth
How many children are you claiming for on this form?
How many original birth certificates, adoption certificates, passports or travel documents are you sending us?
pages.hint_text: If you do not send original documents a decision on your claim will be delayed.

options.value: Birth certificates - only send if the child's birth was registered in Northern Ireland or outside the UK
options.text: Birth certificates - only send if the child's birth was registered in Northern Ireland or outside the UK

pages.question_text: If Yes, tell us the country
Child's full name including last or family name
pages.hint_text: As shown on their birth or adoption certificate.

pages.question_text: Is this child male or female?
Child's date of birth
Has this child's birth been registered in England, Wales or Scotland?
Has this child ever been known by any other name?
Has the name been changed by deed poll?
Is this child yours?

pages.question_text: What is the name and address of the person who claimed Child Benefit for this child?
Does this child live with you in the UK?
pages.hint_text: Read page 4 of the CH2 Notes.

pages.question_text: Has this child lived with anyone else at a different address to you in the last 12 months?

Are you adopting or planning to adopt this child through a local authority?
Do you want to be paid Child Benefit?
pages.hint_text: Only answer this question if either you or your partner have an individual income of more than £60,000 a year. Read page 5 of the CH2 Notes.

pages.question_text: Do you want to be paid Child Benefit every week?
pages.hint_text: We normally pay Child Benefit every 4 weeks into a Bank or building society account. Page 5 of the CH2 Notes tells you if you can be paid every week.

pages.question_text: To get Child Benefit paid every week tick all boxes which apply to you or your partner

options.text: I or my partner receive one or more of the following: Income Support, Income-based Jobseeker's Allowance, Pension Credit, Income-related Employment and Support Allowance, Universal Credit

pages.question_text: Do you already get Child Benefit?
Tick the box which applies to you
pages.hint_text: We can pay Child Benefit into an account that you nominate if the account is capable of receiving direct credit transfer, for example a suitable bank or building society account.

options.text: The account is in my name
The account is in joint names - tell us the names of the account holders in the box below
The account is in someone else's name - tell us the name of the account holder in the box below

pages.question_text: Name of the bank or building society
The branch sort code
pages.hint_text: Read page 5 of the CH2 Notes.

pages.question_text: The account number
pages.hint_text: Read page 5 of the CH2 Notes.

pages.question_text: If the account is with a building society, tell us the roll or reference number if you have it
pages.hint_text: Read page 5 of the CH2 Notes.

pages.question_text: If you do not have an account that we can pay into, put an 'X' in this box
